title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE)
Interview Descriptions: 2 part interview process. It was fine. Required interview with other manager colleagues. Then had to return for interview with manager that I would report to. I got the job.
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral interview questions requiring examples

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very nice location short interview beautiful campus. Not sure why instructed to wear a suit being in nursing...but great description of the position and nice nurse manager! Excited to see what is to come
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: They called me to ask about my interest. Then they emailed me asking the same question. Then they ghosted me. When I followed up, they asked me the same question for a third time before getting a standard rejection email from the same person.
Interview Questions: Are you still interested in this role?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was on-demand, recorded virtual q&a session. The program was easy to use. The second round was a traditional interview (done virtually) with the hiring manager. I did not progress past this round, but based on discussions it sounded like there would be additional interviews and a case / consulting project.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at ChristianaCare?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Process went smoothly. HR communicated clearly and quickly. Interviewers and staff were very professional. An offer came once all steps were completed. Post interview follow up with HR and interviewers went well.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Started reaching out by emails..great customer service and follow ups..let me know I never left a phone number lol was very understanding. I'm really ready to start my career with Christian care
Interview Questions: Why did I choose a career in medical field

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was calm . The person that was interviewing me was very nice and was asking me simple questions I could answer. The interview process lasted about 30 to 45 min., yes it was nerve racking but you gotta show how confident you are while you are being interviewed
Interview Questions: Why did you pick this career choice? How would you describe yourself ?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied for position two weeks later received an email from recruiter requesting a phone screening. Phone screening was basic question. Getting to know your work history, your salary expectations, computer skills. Then it is provided to hiring manager. If manager is interested your informed of an interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply for this position? Why would you want to work for hospital? What are your strengths?

title: Sr. Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Process: I applied for the position in Feb 2022 and had a brief HR phone meeting  in March followed by a zoom meeting in April. I received final notification at the end of May (I had already accepted a different position elsewhere so their decision had no impact) 

The HR screening went well- questions included my experience working with multiple populations, public health interventions, evaluation experience, my interest in the position and in CC in particular. Whether I would be willing to relocate. I was also asked about my years of research experience and education before they inquired about my desired salary (these were  among the first questions- I asked them for their range instead of giving a number first). I was asked to email my CV and writing samples after the meeting with HR. They provided the benefit information by email before scheduling the zoom meeting with the team. 

The 60 min zoom meeting included three team members and I was asked to present a study I had conducted in 10 min. The meeting felt rushed and uncomfortable with team members interrupting each other. It was also awkward with the team not seemingly having answers to basic questions about the position I was interviewing for and explaining concepts for which I have degrees in. The team seemed disinterested in my presentation and to be honest, at that point, I knew I would not want to work there even if offered the position. Other questions included my education, work experience, experiences working with diverse populations, research and evaluation experience. I was told I would hear from them in a few weeks and I forgot to withdraw my application.
Interview Questions:
What are your salary expectations? 

What experience do you have working with diverse populations? 

Why Christiana Care?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy. Applied online through their website, submitted recommendations, received an email for interviews that were virtual videos, submitted my floors of interest, received my next email regarding availability for interviews with the nurse managers on the available floors
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to interview on this unit?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Video interview first via Hirevue which consisted of recording answers to 6 pre-selected questions. Easy questions but make sure you have a script ready just in case. You can re-record your answers as many times as you want.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Online application
Self-recorded initial interview - about 3 minute answer period for question prompts, ability to re-record if you are unhappy with your answers.  
Live, online follow-up interview lasting about 45 minutes with members of the unit(s) who are considering your application
Interview Questions: Are you available to work all shifts, especially overnights?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It wasn’t difficult but there was not a lot of communication. I was asked twice to let them know if I got another offer during the process. I did and sent them a message, and they never responded. I was surprised to be ghosted after three interviews. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the Director of my department. Had one phone interview and then main interview was on Teams. The majority of the questions were directly related to the position I was interviewing for. There were also questions about relating my current position to the future position I now hold. My interviewer was very easy to talk to and alleviated any anxiety right away.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in making a change after 20 years at the bedside with ChristianaCare

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Video recording interview with some written responses. For recording responses, you can record again if the first response did not work out. Don't panic just try one more time. Total of 30 minutes. Then, I had an interview with the department head. The whole process is very friendly and casual.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Why do you want to work at ChristianaCare?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Application process was simple. They didn't require anything 'unusual'. You do have to upload your transcript and have 3 people complete references for you. After application, invited for a pre-recorded. If selected by a specific unit, interview and zoom interview with selected department.
Interview Questions:
- Why did you choose nursing as a career path?
- What causes you to be interested in the Christiana Care Health System Nurse Residency programs?
- We all have had a time when we just couldn't get everything done on time. Tell me about a time when this happened to you?
- Tell me about a time when you entered into a room to complete an assessment and the patient/family wasn't helpful? (No eye contact, non-verbal, ect.)
- Often at work, as in school, you will need to work as a team to meet the needs of our patients. Please describe a time where teamwork was lacking and what you did to address it?
- At CCHS, our Professional Practice Model adopts the philosophy of relationship based care. Relationship-based care centers on promoting a healthy and healing environment. Share with us how you could contribute to creating a healing environment for your patients.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Had to interview with several people for Per Diem RN. Had to F/U when I didn't hear back promptly. Glad I followed up. Misrepresentation on the electronic former employee referrals. CCHS allowed me to clarify.
Interview Questions: How did I feel about Magnet hospitals

title: Registered Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions:
-virtual interview where you record your answers
-interview with nurse manager if you are still being considered - 3 members of the unit (nurse manager and clinical leaders/assistant managers), situational questions, questions about you, description of program
Interview Questions: Q: why did you become a nurse

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: The talent recruiting staff was very professional. The entire process was well organized. My point of contact  kept open communication. Treated with respect at every step. Impressive introduction to an outstanding organization.
Interview Questions: Followed a behavior based interview process.

title: Data ENTRY (REMOTE) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and Was scheduled for an interview. 
It was conducted Entirely by text. Interviewed by an attorney who was experienced based on my linked in search. But who knows for sure when you only do a text interview.
Interview Questions:
Why I would be a fit
Whether I could perform duties
Strengths
How friend would describe me

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Hard and competitive and difficult questions that make you think twice before you respond. Questions make you feel the need to answer with multiple answers to ensure you'll have the means to perform the job duties
Interview Questions: What can you do to make christiana a better hospital Why do you feel like you'll make a good employee How will you ensure you show the ability to perform your job duties all while Promoting christianacares motto which is serving with ")ove and excellence" in all of your job duties to your co workers, patients, and family members. How will you promote that in your days work if hired at christana care

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I first had a series of 12 virtual, video-based questions that were pretty generic and related to Christiana's core values. About a month later I interviewed with a nurse manager.
Interview Questions: Describe how your clinical, volunteer, and professional experiences have prepared you for this position

title: Food Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Didn’t apply through the company, applied through a temp agency & got hired on 3 months later. No interview required. Job agency is Aerotek. Nice job with beautiful spirits around.
Interview Questions: How well do I work with others?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Recorded interview questions and submitted. A few weeks later had a face to face interview. Very positive experience. Not an intimidating interview. Asked normal interview questions and answered any questions I had without hesitation.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was nice and friendly. Both times I was for sure I was a good fit but unfortunately never heard back.  I wish the company would do some sort of follow up even if you don’t get the position instead of leaving candidates wondering.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you want to work for this company?

title: Exercise Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
After applying to the position online, I was contacted through email the following day to set up a teleconference with someone from HR. The phone conference was scheduled for the following week and lasted about 20 minutes. She asked me about my clinical experience, scenario-based questions, about my availability, and allowed me to ask any questions that I had about the position. At the end of the phone call, she informed me that I should be contacted by the end of the following week to schedule an in-person visit to the clinic. The phone call took place on a Friday.

The following Monday, I received an email from the clinic director asking me to set up a time to visit the clinic and meet the staff. I was available Tuesday morning, so I went in the next day. The clinic director gave me a tour of the clinic, introduced me to all of the therapists and other technician, then went to his office for an interview. He asked additional questions that went in depth about my past clinical experience, asked what I love most about the job, my future plans, why I want to work for the company, and what sets me apart as a candidate. I finished up the visit by shadowing the therapists and technician on the treatment floor for about 30 minutes.

From there, the clinic director said that he would reach out when he came to a decision.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were about to help a patient or contribute to their care in a positive way that left you feeling proud.

title: Nurse Resident - ER Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short, however the questions asked were very beneficial! They asked many questions about previous experiences. Definitely important to bring multiple copies of your resume because you will be meeting with multiple people
Interview Questions: Why did you pick the Emergency Department?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. One phone screen by an HR representative and one in-person interview with the main boss/future coworkers. Simple enough and quick in response time for setting up the interview.
Interview Questions: Why Christiana Care?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, had to answer questions online via video then was called to schedule an in person interview.  Via video you would have about 30 seconds to read a question then you had to record your answer, you could record for up to about two minutes. You did not have much time to think.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Christina Care

title: Process Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is pretty straight forward. Starting with the HR and then a phone interview with the department. You might be invited to a visit after if they are interested. They probably will ask you to have a presentation and meet a couple of people. After that, you can expect an offer.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience, examples of previous projects. Expectations, how do you see yourself in the next couple of years.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: They asked standard and generic questions including tell me about yourself, what are your strengths and weaknesses, why did you apply for this job and what makes you a qualified candidate for this role
Interview Questions: They asked tell me about yourself

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: There was a video interview  and a phone interview.  The video interview was not live. It was recorded. There were practice questions like what makes you a good fit for Christiana Care and what was the most difficult situation you ever had to deal with and descrive how you dealt with a difficult patient?
Interview Questions: Describe an incident of conflict or tension with a coworker and how you resolved it.

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Christiana, DE) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview request by recruiter/HR who asked some general questions to further qualify  candidacy for the position. This was  followed by second phone interview with direct manager and immediate co-workers.
Interview Questions: Describe one of your successes

title: RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Contact through HR. Interview process included one in person interview with a panel of four interviewers.  Interview was about an hour long, and included multiple expected nursing related interview questions. Questions were of average difficulty, interviewers were nice.
Interview Questions: Strengths/Weaknesses

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application; contacted by HR 3-4 weeks later. Completed 30 minute phone screen during which I was asked about my resume experiences. About 1.5 weeks later, completed an in-person interview consisting of a panel that lasted just over an hour. Was told I should hear from HR within 2-3 weeks but I didn't hear anything after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a difficult patient

title: Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Over the phone interview, got the job within minutes.very easy and out going questions. The application part took the longest. They will send
you multiple emails during the hiring process so be on the lookout. For potential emails
Interview Questions: How many years of home care experience do you have ?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with somebody from HR. They asked me many of the same questions that were on the online application that I filled out and submitted. I never heard back from them after the phone interview.
Interview Questions: Are you currently interviewing with any other companies?

title: Critical Care Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: The online video interview was the most stressful part in my opinion. Says there will be 11 or 12 questions but there ended up only being 5 that required a video response. The in person interview was a panel with the nurse educator and 2 RNs.  All questions we're behavioral based questions
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a conflict / how did you deal with it (doesn't have to be nursing related)

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel of three people and a series of questions. It was relaxed and more of an open conversation. It was about 45 minutes. Very quick with getting interviews done and letting you know where you stand.
Interview Questions:
Why did I become a nurse?
Clinical scenario questions

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
This process spanned about a month. 
It started off with uploading the requirements online. A couple of days later I got an email about getting references to fill out an online survey on my performance (so have your clinical references ready before applying, at least 2). 
After the references, I did an automated online interview that had 7 video questions and like 5 written questions. The video questions ranged from "Tell me about your clinical experiences" to "Why Christiana?" to "Tell me about a time you dealt with a difficult patient". 
After completing this online interview, I received an email to schedule an in-person interview at the Newark hospital. The interview lasted a solid 45 min- 1 hour. The interviewers were both nurses, very kind and encouraging. 
Make sure to get their business cards/emails so you can contact them afterwards thanking them for the opportunity. 
Also, wear something professional, but also something that stands out! (Oh I remember her, she wore that yellow dress) 
Also, relax. Trust in the process. Go over your answers and give them the old' Excellence and Love razzle dazzle!
Interview Questions: Why Christiana?

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly recruiter. She is very patient. The entire interview is relaxed. There was no tough question, just normal interview question, such as your past experience and your educational background.
Interview Questions: Describe one of your experience of teamwork

title: Construction Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview with director of facilities. The interview was very informal, not a lot of technical questions. The dress code for executives and managers is very formal. The culture seems very cut throat and challenging.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Describe your past experience

title: Home Health Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and completed the assessment. Got an email within a week for a recruiter interview. Interview went very well, and she quoted salary and benefits. She told me to expect a call from the manager for a face to face interview. I got a rejection letter 2 business days later. Needless to say, I am confused. I’ve done hiring myself, and you never tell someone to expect another step in the interview process unless you mean it. She was very nice and professional.  I emailed about my confusion, but I have gotten no response. It’s disappointing.
Interview Questions: Situational questions about past experiences

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview & panel interview with 1 nurse,1 manger, 1 supervisor & 1 doctor in the room. It was easy - they asked about my experience, my expectations, why I wanted to work there. It was a good experience.
Interview Questions:
List your scope of work 
Challenges you dealt with

title: RN Residency Interview
Application Type: The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied and got an email saying I was selected for a web virtual interview about a week later. Did that and got a call within a few days to set up an interview in person the following week. After interview I didn't hear back for over a month. I know I was more qualified to get the job than most applicants but I believe they hire lots of UD and del tech grads. The in person interview was quick and a bit dry. I didn't feel good coming out of it and a bit uninterested in the job to be honest. Maybe they sensed it? It was my first interview so it was nice experience.
Interview Questions: What are some things you saw in the ED?

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very efficient. The staff seemed to care about the future employees right from the beginning. I did have to wait longer than expected for a face to face interview but it was wirth the wait.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to solve a problem at your previous job.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 4 weeks. Talked to HR recruiter, then in-person interview with hiring manager/future supervisor. During the interview, talked about why I want to work at Christiana Care, future endeavors and went over resume to highlight relevant experience. Pleasant interview process. Formal but casual environment.
Interview Questions: Go over resume and past experiences.

title: Administrative Role Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an HR Coordinator by email and asked about my relevant experience. Once I responded, the rep was very excited and I was sent an assessment and told to complete it.  Before starting the assessment, another HR rep viewed my profile on LinkedIn. It's private, so all you see is my current title (relevant) and my photo.  I never heard from the organization again despite attempts to contact them. Obviously, this is quite disconcerting.
Interview Questions: Do you have at least five years of relevant experience?

title: Service Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very smooth. The manager is very nice and asks the typical interview questions. Provides a description of the job but does leave some vital information out.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for christiana care?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with different members of the department, interviewed with 2 to 3 employees. Relatively short interview with direct questions. Big hospital so be sure to leave plenty of time to park and find a spot. It takes a decent amount of time to walk within the hospital's campus. Be sure to bring copies of your resume for all members of the panel.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with agency, face to face interview at agency, and interview with hiring manager.  I was essentially offered the position on the spot, pending successful completion of background check.
Interview Questions: Interview was straightforward questions about experience.  No situational or behavioral questions.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy. They called and scheduled a phone interview with the HR department. Once the phone interview was complete (after about 5 days or so) I received a call from HR saying they wanted to schedule and interview with the Nursing managers from the unit I applied to. I interviewed with my Nursing manager and Assistant Nurse manager, it was about 20 minutes long. They asked me the basic questions, why do you want this job etc. I was offered the job a few days later via phone call.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Christiana Care?

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview followed by an in-person interview. It was a little intimidating with 6 people questioning me at once. The questions were expected questions, nothing too difficult or unforseeable. They did ask nursing-related questions though (with patient scenarios). I also was able to get a tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you showed your ability to multitask

title: Office Assistant/Medial Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Atmosphere was very comfortable which made me feel right at ease. Interviewers were very nice and understanding of my nervousness. The panel was professional but also it was so comfortable and relaxing, we could throw in a little humor. I felt as if I had the job on the spot because the interview was on a Friday and they asked me if I was available on Monday. Of course I had to wait for the temp agency t contact me.
Interview Questions: How do I deal with irate customers.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I apply to every single opening that fits for my experience as a new grad. Eventually i received a email to do a assessment. The assesment had the general very much agree/disagree format with a ton of math. It was timed.

Then i had a recruiter call me and transcribe a interview.

Then i had another recruiter interview me for a specific job.

Then i had another call from a secretary of a nurse manager to set up an face to face interview.

the face to face interview consisted of nurse manager, charge nurse and assistant manager. 

Interview lasted an hour with a tour of the floor to finish it off. i was one of twenty applicants. i was told the decision would be by the end of the week and i would recieve a call. two weeks later and nothing.
Interview Questions: What was the most diffult patient you have had to deal with

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked several different questions: how do you handle difficult patients, give an example; why do want to work for Christiana Care, any questions for the interviewer, your best and worst traits, etc.
Interview Questions: What is your best and worst trait?

title: IT Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions:
Recruited externally...phone interview.  Went on-site, spent about 20 minutes with 5 IT employees.  Went to HR, filled out an application, talked to an HR rep.

The IT team were all cordial and straightforward.  The HR person seemed to hate life and allegedly is the one who DQ'd me for a comment about how I had problems finding the interviewer as it was before the typical workday.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you've had a deadline and how you handled it.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: easy and quick. Very friendly managers and recruiters. Everything is done in a timely manner. Make you feel comfortable during the enterview. Plenty of opportunities for questions. Called back the same day after the enterview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Christiana care

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: People are very easy to interview. I had interned for the organization. Being a chaplain is all about relationship, forming connections with people and being able to listen to people. They want people who are authentic to who they are and willing to learn and do the work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position? How do you engage with people?

title: Student Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it is very informal.  I met with three groups of people. Mostly talked about the different aspects of this internship; technical skills, past experience, and teamwork experience. After meeting with the team, I had a phone interview with the HR to discuss compensation, and schedule. The lady was very nice and professional. The pay was not as well as I expected.
Interview Questions: Why Christiana Care, why healthcare. Why did I leave my last position.

title: Patient/Physician Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview first. Then I interviewed with the assistant director. I also had to fill out a three page document that had questions about your personality and also spelling questions. The interview lasted around a half hour. The basic questions about why you are qualified and your experience were asked.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this position?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: short unprofessional , manager kept answering her phone act as though she didn’t want to be there. She brag how she got the job because of her connection. christiana care is very clicky
Interview Questions: Why you want work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ChristianaCare
Interview Descriptions: Everyone on staff was very kind to me. Setting up my interview was easy, and the interviewees were very nice. I've only had one interview prior to this so I do not have much to compare it to, but it was very relaxed. They read off a list of questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you disagreed with another worker and how you resolved it.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with nursing staff on the floor. Went to managers office. Was a bit crowded. Each person was given the opportunity to ask questions in regards to my skills and ability to accomplish tasks
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Got a phone call about recieving an interview, was called onto the unit and had the interview with the floor nursing manager & also the scheduling manager sat in. Went very well- basic "why do you want to be a nurse, and what experience do you have so far:" "Why do you want to work on this type of floor" etc. 

Followed up with a background check online & a phone call from HR with another interview with basically scenario questions basic nursing drill. They offered me the position over the phone with hourly rate and scheduling. 

Very great experience
Interview Questions: 5 good qualities about myself (always hard for me to give myself the credit i deserve)

title: Staff RN/E Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with the manager who did not ask me one question regarding my experience or job history. Less than 5 minutes were spent in the interview process and then I was taken to observe the working staff and permitted to ask questions. I was given the impression that the interview was merely a formality and that I would be offered the position as I was highly qualified.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Material Handler Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: A Human Resources employee will contact you first, there will be a phone interview then a face-to-face interview with the area supervisor.  If you are not offered the job, you will get an email.
Interview Questions: Where I want to be in 5 years

title: Ultrasound Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with section supervisor and met with HR after for job offer. We went over expecations of job requirements and limitations, was asked to scan to prove compitent, and later met with HR to discuss further paper work to be completed along with the job offer listed in writing for me to sign. Great experience
Interview Questions: How do you feel that you would benefit as a team member

title: Senior HRIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE)
Interview Descriptions:
I have been called by a manager and scheduled phone round interview. And phone round went around 40 minutes. All are behavioral questions..like
1. What is the innovative idea that you have given?
2. When is the time you have learnt something new for your job?
3. What is the most you like in your current job?
Interview Questions: Nothing was unexpected...I was able answer almost all of them. But after 2 days, I got an email that I am not short listed for further process.

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
If you receive an interview in IT, be prepared to wait a while as they have to coordinate schedules. So you may be waiting a while just to get in. 

If you do your research, you'll see that there are a lot of IT folks that have been there for quite a while. Also one thing to note is to watch the job postings as they "renew" them. So you may see a spot come and go, but that job positing has been there for months. I got the feeling that they are very picky, so look at the job requirements, and the more you fit, the better your chances.
Interview Questions: The interviews vary between departments, but be prepared to discuss your current/past duties. You will most likely have a long detailed and lengthy interview process that is tailored to your current skills set.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE)
Interview Descriptions: Took a month to get the interview after submitting online application then over 2 weeks for the offer and another 2 weeks before orientation started; met with HR first then the assistant Nurse Manager
Interview Questions: Can't recall any difficulty during the interview process for a staff position

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (New Castle, DE) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was behind the scenes of HR.  Didn't get hired the normal route.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Wilmington, DE) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the position and was contacted by HR manager within 2 weeks. Interview was very straightforward, but standard and somewhat generic. Two people (one senior manager, one person from department who was pulled in to fill a spot and had nothing to do with position) asked me questions off of a list that they went through. Generic strengths/weaknesses, behavioral-based experience questions. Not a ton of feedback during interview, but I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time in the recent past that you had an ethical dilemma and how did you handle it?

title: Biomedical Equipment Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at ChristianaCare (Newark, DE) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed first with HR, and one on one interview, then I interviewed with the Director, and Supervisor.  All in all, both interviews lasted about 3.5 hours. I left the interview feeling as though I did not get the job, but the next day they called and gave me an offer. I accepted and started one month later.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now.
